subNodes.conversationText: root

How did you ever survive before I came? I am telling you that the force I saw was not small, and that it was dangerously close to the town. Do you realize how ideal a location Drawn Swords would be for them?|***ga_face_target-->String::vroman String::ianth Int::0 ***ga_global_int-->String::ndshow_var String::1 ***ga_global_int-->String::vroman_inf String::1 |
|***ga_jump_players-->String::intro3_wp1    Int::1    Int::1    |
Miss Lavillus, begging your pardon, but last I checked I was leader of Drawn Swords. Caution is what's gotten us through the years safely--caution and this old keep.
If we threw stones at every party of Zhentarim that camped near the base of our crag, there'd be no more stones in Drawn Swords.  No more people, for that matter.
But look, Ianth, it seems there's some folks that want to talk to you.
Indeed.  We have questions regarding the death of Vroman's brother.
[To Vroman.] I understand, and once again, condole your loss. [Less formally, for a moment.] Sune teaches us what it means to love; life in Faerun teaches us what it means to lose.

If you wish to know how he died, I will tell you.  He was greatly outnumbered by brigands in the woods; he fought bravely against them, but his magic--he was a wizard of no small talent, it seems--could not prevail against so many.  I arrived too late.
Who were these brigands?
Evil men.  Marauders.
<color=green>[Listen] Zhentarim, perhaps?</color>|***gc_skill_dc-->NOT::False    Int::12    Int::10    |

So you overheard my conversation with Hamfast.  It would be useless to hide it from you--yes, they were Zhentarim.  Zhentil Keep is far from here, but Darkhold is close.|***ga_local_int-->String::zhent    String::1    String::hamfast    ***ga_give_xp-->Int::100    Int::0    |
The Zhentarim!  By the gods, poor Manfred!  He could have had no idea.
Interesting indeed.  Continue with your story, Ianth.|***ga_local_int-->String::zhent    String::1    String::hamfast    |
Those bastards should pay.
Is there anything else you can tell me about them?
What happened next?
I slew the men who injured him.  Manfred then told me his name, and Vroman's, and also that you were all to meet at the Sword and Dragon.  You know the rest.
Manfred fought well, you say?  Then his magic wasn't entirely useless after all.  I am glad of that.
Indeed, I was surprised he lasted as long as he did.  Physically he was quite weak.

That is often the case with those of us who practice magic, though you should know that our talents more than makes up for our lack of bodily strength.|***gc_check_class-->NOT::False    Int::10    ***gc_check_class-->NOT::False    Int::9    |
You do not need to prove yourself to me, stranger.
There is nothing else you will tell us?  Why did they want him dead?|***gc_local_int-->NOT::True    String::zhent    String::1    String::hamfast    |
I know only that Manfred fought bravely, and that his last thoughts were of his brother.  They probably wanted him dead because he was in their--territory, or because they wanted his possessions.
Oh, Miss Lavillus, why don't you just tell them?  I would want to know if my brother'd been done in by a dirty Zhent.
The Zhentarim!  By the gods, poor Manfred!  He could have had no idea.
So the Zhentarim who killed Manfred are based near Drawn Swords, Ianth?
It is a matter that does not concern you directly.
[Diplomacy] "Directly," you say. I would say that the murder of Vroman's brother by one of their number is a rather direct way of concerning us.

[Success] Very well.  Yes, the Zhentarim are based near here.  You interrupted us as we discussed the problem.  Manfred was probably killed because he stumbled upon the encampment unawares.||***ga_give_xp-->Int::100    Int::0    ***gc_skill_dc-->NOT::False    Int::6    Int::12    ||
<color=red>[Intimidate] Listen, Ianth.  We will get our answers sooner or later.  Let's not talk in circles.

[Success] Very well.  Yes, the Zhentarim are based near here.  You interrupted us as we discussed the problem.  Manfred was probably killed because he stumbled upon the encampment unawares.||***ga_give_xp-->Int::100    Int::0    ***gc_skill_dc-->NOT::False    Int::11    Int::13    ||
How can you be so sure?
Please, stranger. I have told you and Vroman what you needed to know. [To Vroman.] I am sorry for your loss, but I have nothing more to say on this subject.
Manfred was my brother, Ianth. The details are important to me.
Hmm...Well, I suppose it would not hurt for you to know more of the truth.
The Zhentarim are based near here. You interrupted us as we discussed the problem. Manfred was probably killed because he stumbled upon the encampment unawares.

Then you, Milady, are in luck.  Vroman and I are adventurers, and nothing would please us more than to investigate the Zhentarim presence ourselves.|***ga_global_int-->String::courteous    String::++    |
Do you speak truly, <FirstName>?  I owe it to Manfred, but those who cross the Black Network rarely live to tell the tale.
Yes, Vroman.  Justice will be served.|***ga_global_int-->String::moral    String::++    |
That is true, and it is good to hear you say it.  I am not sure whether to be glad or grim about this enterprise, though.
Be glad.  We will avenge your brother.
Then glad I will be! Or--as glad as I can be, given the circumstances.
You are getting ahead of yourselves.  I did not intend to draw the two of you any further into this.
Maybe not, Miss Lavillus, but you have.  It doesn't seem like a bad idea to me.
What?  Then you take the problem seriously after all.

I never said I didn't take the Zhents seriously, especially if they're camped as close to Drawn Swords as you say.  It's just that I can't endanger any folk of the town by doing anything about it.  Our neutrality has always been one of our greatest advantages out here in the wild.
That said, I have no problem with freelancers getting involved. [Grinning.] You know, I sometimes forget that you're a freelancer yourself, Miss Lavillus.
[A sad smile flits over Ianth's face.] Me too, Hamfast, me too. To think that I have let another year of my youth slip by in this desolate place--
In any case, you are right.  I hope you have no qualms about me showing you the way.
On the contrary, we would be most delighted to have you join us.|***ga_global_int-->String::courteous    String::++    |
You are very gracious; thank you.  If your words are any indication, we will get along well,--|***ga_global_int-->String::ianth_inf    String::++    |
Qualms?  Not at all.
Good,--
We have no choice, I suppose.|***ga_global_int-->String::abrasive    String::++    |
No, you really don't.  Let us at least be civil to each other,--
<FirstName>.

A pleasure to meet you, <FirstName>.  I think what would best serve us all would be a covert effort to survey the camp.  There are small parties of Zhentarim about, so combat will be unavoidable, but we should not try to take all of them on at once.|***ga_roster_add_object-->String::iianth_ros    String::ianth    ***ga_roster_party_add-->String::iianth_ros    ***ga_journal-->String::Q_MANFRED    Int::10    Int::1    Int::1    Int::0    ***ga_reset_level-->String::ianth    Int::1    |
Why do you think the Zhentarim are here?
I do not know.  As I said, Darkhold, a stronghold of theirs, is nearby--a two or three days' march, I would say.  They are not uncommon in Northdark Wood, but the force I saw seemed unduly large.
What exactly do we need to find out?
If we can, what they are doing here--or what they are planning on doing. Anything else that we can ascertain about their presence--numbers, provisions, and the like, could also prove useful.
Tell me more about the Zhentarim.

Surely you know of the Black Network--the web of spies, merchants, and dark clerics and warriors who seek to manipulate, connive, and control Faerun?  Their presence is strongest in the Moonsea, but they have agents almost everywhere.
Onward, then.|***ga_give_feat-->String::ianth    Int::16778917    Int::0    Int::0    |

I'd advise you to prepare yourselves well before heading into Northdark Wood.  Ianth can tell you more, but Zhents aren't the only monsters that lurk there.  I wouldn't be a good salesman if I didn't add that I have arms and armor to sell.
Thank you, Hamfast.
Of course.  Can I see your goods?|***ga_open_store-->String::hamfast_store    Int::0    Int::0    |
<FullName>, at your service.|***ga_global_int-->String::courteous    String::++    |
Be grim.  The Zhentarim are not opponents to take lightly.
Indeed.  We should proceed with as much caution as we can.
I will not choose for you, Vroman.
I guess I should have expected that.  Perhaps it is too early to know anyway.
[Nod.] It's the right thing to do.
[Shrug.] We don't have any other plans.|***ga_global_int-->String::ironic String::++ |
I see. It seems as if the situation favors both of us, then. You want the Zhentarim presence investigated, and we are adventurers who want both revenge and work.
[Nod.] We could look into the matter for you.
So the Zhentarim who killed Manfred are based near Drawn Swords, Ianth?|***gc_local_int-->NOT::False    String::zhent    String::1    String::hamfast    |
Nothing more?  This is not much to go on.|***gc_local_int-->NOT::True    String::zhent    String::1    String::hamfast    |
[Nod.] We have questions for you.
